searchDocs.title: Import the Trevas TS engine​
searchDocs.content: yarn add @inseefr/trevas

searchDocs.title: Configure WebAssembly mode and call the Trevas TS engine​
searchDocs.content: By default, Trevas TS engine will run In-memory.  To configure an other implementation, you have to add the key $vtl.engine.processing_engine_names to your bindings.  For WebAssembly mode, the value has to be wasm.  import { interpret, type Bindings } from 'trevas'; const bindings: Bindings = { k: 'v', '$vtl.engine.processing_engine_names': 'wasm', }; const result = interpret('VTL expression', bindings);

searchDocs.title: What is VTL?​
searchDocs.content: Business, logical-level and user-friendly language for statisticiansRelies on standard structural metadataInteroperable, platform-agnosticFunctional language, enabling data lineage for more insight and reproductibility

searchDocs.title: Trevas TS​
searchDocs.content: Trevas TS partially covers the definition of VTL.  Have a look to the coverage section for more information.

searchDocs.title: Trevas TS >= 1.0.0​
searchDocs.content: The version of VTL is 2.1.  The library exposes the interpret function, taking 2 arguments, the VTL expression and a bindings object.  BasicScalarTypes, Bindings, Component and Dataset types are also exposed.  For more informations, a developer guide is available.

searchDocs.title: Trevas TS < 1.0.0​
searchDocs.content: The version of VTL is 2.0.  Versions below version 1.0.0 of Trevas were implemented in JavaScript, using antlr4 and an inconsistent Dataset model.  It is not recommended to use these versions.

searchDocs.title: Import the Trevas TS engine​
searchDocs.content: yarn add @inseefr/trevas

searchDocs.title: Call the Trevas TS engine​
searchDocs.content: import { interpret, type Bindings } from 'trevas'; const bindings: Bindings = { sca: 1, DS_1: { dataStructure: [ { name: 'id', type: 'STRING', role: 'IDENTIFIER' }, { name: 'col1', type: 'INTEGER', role: 'MEASURE' }, { name: 'col2', type: 'NUMBER', role: 'MEASURE' }, ], dataPoints: [ ['a', 1, 1.1], ['b', 2, 2.2], ['c', 3, 303.33], ], }, }; const result = interpret('sca + DS_1', bindings);

searchDocs.title: WebAssembly mode​
searchDocs.content: See here the dedicated documentation.
